column4: I"m going to update fstab and try it again using mount -a eternalswd
I recently upgraded to fiesty and now my DVD and CDROM drives are not mounting...k3b can't burn to them, but freevo will play a movie if I put it in...but still no mounting...can anyone assist?
hello netyire I'm back again
I have a similar issue such as what you describe, try doing lshw and see what it reports of any cdrom like drives
I think the problem is they are on the same port or something and udev set it up wrong.
does it automount anything onto your desktop when you place media into it?
anyway to auto reconfigure for fstab?
yes, but it still tells me it's not mounted!!!
I have a wusb54gsc wireless usb adapter and lexmark x83 printer I had to set custom rules for in udev, I'm guessing something similar to that
I can play music cds and watch movies though...oddd
that is very odd.. perhaps do mess with fstab some

though I have this ati radeon video card in this computer working fine but it says in lshw its "unclaimed" I have no clue what that means but there are other devices like that, does it say that about your drive?
I think its only using half the dedicated video ram in this comp :/
no it gives me the description and other info is all filled in
are these devices external or connected through a firewire?
nope
reminds me of a funny problem I had with a laptop before, it had a floppy drive that could be switched out with a dvd drive. I couldn't boot off of it and it thought both drives were same one
by switching a real cdrom drive in and turning off floppy I could install but didn't have that drive so I did a network based install of xubuntu :)
would you mind posting a forum about your problem? perhaps I can comment about mine too because it sounds very similar
I mean I haven't tried mine yet but it says it won't burn
maybe, but right now I want a solution...oh, did I mention I want it now?   :)
/join #gerro a sec :)
